meanings.definition: To dig up (a body) from the ground.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist was disinterring ancient bones for study.
meanings.sent2: The gravedigger was disinterring the coffin to move it to a different location.
meanings.sent3: The curious dog tried disinterring a bone buried in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: She felt like disinterring memories long buried in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The detective's job was to disinter secrets hidden in the past.

meanings.definition: To uncover or bring to light (something hidden or forgotten).
meanings.sent1: The journalist was disinterring old documents to expose the truth.
meanings.sent2: The historian was disinterring lost manuscripts from the archives.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed disinterring buried treasure in the sandbox.
meanings.sent4: Her research helped disinter the long-forgotten history of the town.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight seemed to disinter the beauty of the old painting.
